alert.note: Alert for Cheatham (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 3:33AM CST until February 25 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River Near Kingston Springs affecting Cheatham County. For the Harpeth River...including Kingston Springs, Bellevue, Franklin, Franklin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Harpeth River Near Kingston Springs. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flooding of the Kingston Springs City Park begins and water approaches Pinnacle Hill Road and East Kingstons Springs Road. Several secondary roads near the river become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 16.8 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.7 feet this evening. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM CST.
